net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.dnd

Interface DropTarget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FieldComponentDropTarget, VerticalContainerDropTarget

    public interface DropTarget
    The target of a drag and drop operation. An instance is used as an argument to the Component#setDropTarget(DropTarget) method to enable the drop target. Drag and drop will automatically be enabled if at least one component with a drag source and at least one other component with a drop target are shown (see Component.isShown().
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drop(Transferable transferable, DropLocationIdentifier location, DropOption option)
      Process the result of a drag and drop operation.

    • Method Detail

      • drop

        void drop(Transferable transferable,
        DropLocationIdentifier location,
        DropOption option)
        Process the result of a drag and drop operation. If an error occurs it is the responsibility of this method to take appropriate action such as displaying a message.
        Parameters:
        transferable - the data from the source.
        location - the enum value at the location of the drop as defined by getDropLocations(), may be null.
        option - the option the user has chosen for the drop, may be null.

      • getAcceptedContentTypes

        Collection<ContentType> getAcceptedContentTypes()
        Get the supported content types for this target. This method may be called many times in a short period of time and should be efficient.
        Returns:
        Collection of ContentType.

      • getDropLocations

        DropLocation getDropLocations()
        Get the description of the drop locations.
        Returns:
        DropLocation, must not be null.

      • getDropOptions

        Collection<DropOption> getDropOptions(Transferable transferable)
        Get the options for dropping the given Transferable.
        Parameters:
        transferable - the transferable that may be given in drop(Transferable, DropLocationIdentifier, DropOption).
        Returns:
        collection of drop options, may be empty but not null.

      • hasDropOptions

        boolean hasDropOptions()
        Check if the target may return more than one DropOption from getDropOptions(Transferable). This method should return true if at least one condition would cause multiple drop options to be available. It must be a stable value over the lifetime of the DropTarget.
        Returns:
        true if there is a possibility of multiple drop options from getDropOptions(Transferable).
